SEARCH
Package controller

Class ControllProgramFlow

java.lang.Object
controller.ControllProgramFlow
public class ControllProgramFlow extends Object
Controller handling the main program flow, managing user input and interaction. This class communicates with the model to update or retrieve data and passes information to the view for displaying text on the screen.
Version:
1.2
Author:
Michal Walus
See Also:
  • PrintMenu

  • Constructor Details

  • Method Details

    • checkIfUsernameGood

      public void checkIfUsernameGood(String[] args, User someUser)
      Validates the username provided by the user. The username must meet the requirement of being a single argument from the command line and starting with a letter. If the username is invalid, the method will repeatedly prompt the user until a valid name is provided.
      Parameters:
      args - Arguments from the command line (optional); the program works without them.
      someUser - Object representing the user currently running the application.
      See Also:
      • User

    • getIntFromUser

      public int getIntFromUser()
      Reads an integer input from the user. Handles exceptions if the input is not a valid integer, and prompts the user to enter the value again.
      Returns:
      The valid integer provided by the user.
      See Also:
      • User

    • getStringFromUser

      public String getStringFromUser()
      Reads a string input from the user.
      Returns:
      The string input provided by the user.
      See Also:
      • User

    • printAllNotices

      public void printAllNotices(NoticeList notices)
      Displays all notices currently in the system. The notices are retrieved from the model, and the details are passed to the view for printing.
      Parameters:
      notices - The object containing all notices in the system.
      See Also:
      • NoticeList

    • addNewNotice

      public void addNewNotice(NoticeList notices, String givenAuthor)
      Adds a new notice to the system. The user provides the title and text for the notice, and the author's nickname is automatically assigned based on the username.
      Parameters:
      notices - The object containing all notices in the system.
      givenAuthor - The nickname provided by the user currently running the application.
      See Also:
      • NoticeList
      • User

    • deleteNotice

      public void deleteNotice(NoticeList notices)
      Deletes a specific notice chosen by the user. The user selects the notice from a list, and the notice is then removed from the system.
      Parameters:
      notices - The object containing all notices in the system.
      See Also:
      • NoticeList

    • checkSpecificNotice

      public void checkSpecificNotice(NoticeList notices)
      Displays the details of a specific notice chosen by the user.
      Parameters:
      notices - The object containing all notices in the system.
      See Also:
      • NoticeList

    • printMainMenu

      public void printMainMenu()
      Displays all options from the main menu.
